<a id="CollisionPolygon2D"></a>

# CollisionPolygon2D

**Inherits:** [Node2D](Node2D.md) **\<** [CanvasItem](CanvasItem.md) **\<** [Node](Node.md) **\<** [Object](Object.md)

A node that provides a polygon shape to a [CollisionObject2D](CollisionObject2D.md) parent.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

A node that provides a polygon shape to a [CollisionObject2D](CollisionObject2D.md) parent and allows to edit it. The polygon can be concave or convex. This can give a detection shape to an [Area2D](Area2D.md), turn [PhysicsBody2D](PhysicsBody2D.md) into a solid object, or give a hollow shape to a [StaticBody2D](StaticBody2D.md).

\ **Warning:** A non-uniformly scaled **CollisionPolygon2D** will likely not behave as expected. Make sure to keep its scale the same on all axes and adjust its polygon instead.

<!-- classref-reftable-group -->

<!-- classref-descriptions-group -->

## Enumerations

<a id="enum_CollisionPolygon2D_BuildMode"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration -->

enum **BuildMode**: [ðŸ”—](#enum_CollisionPolygon2D_BuildMode)

<a id="CollisionPolygon2D_constant_BUILD_SOLIDS"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[BuildMode](CollisionPolygon2D.md#enum_CollisionPolygon2D_BuildMode) **BUILD_SOLIDS** = `0`

Collisions will include the polygon and its contained area. In this mode the node has the same effect as several [ConvexPolygonShape2D](ConvexPolygonShape2D.md) nodes, one for each convex shape in the convex decomposition of the polygon (but without the overhead of multiple nodes).<a id="CollisionPolygon2D_constant_BUILD_SEGMENTS"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[BuildMode](CollisionPolygon2D.md#enum_CollisionPolygon2D_BuildMode) **BUILD_SEGMENTS** = `1`

Collisions will only include the polygon edges. In this mode the node has the same effect as a single [ConcavePolygonShape2D](ConcavePolygonShape2D.md) made of segments, with the restriction that each segment (after the first one) starts where the previous one ends, and the last one ends where the first one starts (forming a closed but hollow polygon).<hr class="classref-section-separator"/>

<!-- classref-descriptions-group -->

## Property Descriptions

<a id="CollisionPolygon2D_property_build_mode"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[BuildMode](CollisionPolygon2D.md#enum_CollisionPolygon2D_BuildMode) **build_mode** = `0` [ðŸ”—](#CollisionPolygon2D_property_build_mode)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_build_mode**\ (\ value\: [BuildMode](CollisionPolygon2D.md#enum_CollisionPolygon2D_BuildMode)\ )
- [BuildMode](CollisionPolygon2D.md#enum_CollisionPolygon2D_BuildMode) **get_build_mode**\ (\ )

Collision build mode.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="CollisionPolygon2D_property_disabled"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[bool](bool.md) **disabled** = `false` [ðŸ”—](#CollisionPolygon2D_property_disabled)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_disabled**\ (\ value\: [bool](bool.md)\ )
- [bool](bool.md) **is_disabled**\ (\ )

If ``true``, no collisions will be detected. This property should be changed with [Object.set_deferred()](Object.md#Object_method_set_deferred).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="CollisionPolygon2D_property_one_way_collision"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[bool](bool.md) **one_way_collision** = `false` [ðŸ”—](#CollisionPolygon2D_property_one_way_collision)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_one_way_collision**\ (\ value\: [bool](bool.md)\ )
- [bool](bool.md) **is_one_way_collision_enabled**\ (\ )

If ``true``, only edges that face up, relative to **CollisionPolygon2D**'s rotation, will collide with other objects.

\ **Note:** This property has no effect if this **CollisionPolygon2D** is a child of an [Area2D](Area2D.md) node.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="CollisionPolygon2D_property_one_way_collision_margin"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[float](float.md) **one_way_collision_margin** = `1.0` [ðŸ”—](#CollisionPolygon2D_property_one_way_collision_margin)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_one_way_collision_margin**\ (\ value\: [float](float.md)\ )
- [float](float.md) **get_one_way_collision_margin**\ (\ )

The margin used for one-way collision (in pixels). Higher values will make the shape thicker, and work better for colliders that enter the polygon at a high velocity.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="CollisionPolygon2D_property_polygon"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[PackedVector2Array](PackedVector2Array.md) **polygon** = `PackedVector2Array()` [ðŸ”—](#CollisionPolygon2D_property_polygon)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_polygon**\ (\ value\: [PackedVector2Array](PackedVector2Array.md)\ )
- [PackedVector2Array](PackedVector2Array.md) **get_polygon**\ (\ )

The polygon's list of vertices. Each point will be connected to the next, and the final point will be connected to the first.

\ **Note:** The returned vertices are in the local coordinate space of the given **CollisionPolygon2D**.

**Note:** The returned array is *copied* and any changes to it will not update the original property value. See [PackedVector2Array](PackedVector2Array.md) for more details.
